Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2008 06:35AM dianaon wrote: Yes. Some BC's do not EVER show up on mammo;  sono also, is a screening tool. I found a lump this August, had a normal mamo in Sept, finaly a sono in Oct, and a Pos. Bx., surgical consult last week, (Lumpectomy scheducled for next month, and the works to follow) I look at the card with the  March 4, 2009 appointment for a f/u mamo & sono they gave me in Sept.(after the normal mamo)  and thank God I knew enough not to go away. Thing is, even if it had not been diagnosed until march or April, I still would probably be ok.
Posts.Title: A lump now what? Debi1220 mkm66

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2009 08:34PM dianaon wrote: For every post there are 100 more just reading & sending private prayers to you and her. My guts tell me she needs faith. That God and many good people will watch out for and love her kids into adulthood, and beyond. Tell her this, (ONLY if YOU are really believing it) and even if you think dhe can't hear you. Love to you all.
